instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Pro

Computer originally came in with bad track pad. Replaced the track pad and sent it back out. 4 months later it returned today.

Computer has Green light that changes to orange
Battery plugged in I get fan spin no boot. Fans pulse on off on off constantly

SMC reset no change
PRAM reset no change

Unplug battery with charger plugged in green light changes to orange wont boot and no fan spin

SMC bypass fan spins on high as it should and computer boots and works. 

No liquid damage and no signs of any other problem. I assume its an SMC issue but not sure where to start

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message:
Yes there is liquid damage that is why the trackpad died and now the board. Probably corroded trace or resistor in the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> sense circuit.
Also need board number if you want specific advice.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

If there is liquid damage Im not seeing it

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message: Measure resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message: That seems ok. What is PPBUS voltage? Are you using a known REAL 85W charger?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message:
Yes getting a third now to test again.

PPBUS 12.45V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message: Must have been the charger. Thank you Duke. Time to order new charger for them and me :/

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Pulsing on off fans no boot
threads.message: Get an  ORIGINAL one from APPLE, no after market junk! Only charger on the work bench should be an 85W.
